page.title: 15DUNNET'S COACHES
page.content:
Dunnets Coaches began transporting goods and passengers over a century ago. Their fleet of coaches is a feature of the village, being garaged in the centre of the village. A small number of local people are employed as drivers and mechanics. Pupils for various schools,including Wick High, Bower, Watten, Keiss, and Canisbay, are carried by Dunnets.
Periodic services to Inverness are made, and parties are taken further afield, including the Continent. It is usually possible to obtain the use of a bus at short notice.
The regular bus services between Wick and John O'Groats are carried out by this firm, there being four return services each day - two in the morning, and two in the afternoon.
